intro: Antinisa involucrata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb, often forming a rosette of foliage. Its flowers, which can be purple, pink, or white, are borne on erect stems and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Antinisa involucrata is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
